BiblioData.Title: ENCAPSULATED DEVICE WITH INTEGRATED GAS PERMEATION SENSOR

Applicant.Name: AGENCY SCIENCE TECH & RES [SG]
AGENCY FOR SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND RESEARCH

BiblioData.Abstract: An encapsulated device comprising an integrated gas permeation sensor is provided, comprising a base substrate with an electronic component arranged thereon being enclosed within an encapsulation for protecting the electronic component from moisture and/or oxygen; at least one sensor is arranged within the encapsulation to measure the permeation of gas into the encapsulation; each sensor comprises an electrically conductive sensing element comprising a moisture and/or oxygen sensitive material, wherein the reaction of said material with moisture and/or oxygen results in a change in the electrical resistance/conductivity of the sensor.

Claims.P: What is claimed is:

1. An encapsulated device, comprising a base substrate, an electronic component arranged on the base substrate and enclosed within an encapsulation that protects the electronic component from moisture and/or oxygen, and at least one gas permeation sensor arranged on the base substrate and enclosed within the encapsulation, said gas permeation sensor being capable of measuring the permeation of gas into the encapsulation, wherein each of said at least one gas permeation sensor comprises: an electrically conductive sensing element comprising a moisture and/or oxygen sensitive material, wherein the reaction of said material with moisture and/or oxygen results in a change in the electrical resistance/conductivity of the sensing element, and an electrical connector capable of connecting the sensing element to a signal evaluation unit.
2. The device of Claim 1 , wherein a plurality of gas permeation sensors are arranged within the encapsulation.
3. The device of Claim 2, wherein the plurality of gas permeation sensors is arranged in a regular grid around the electronic component.
4. The device of Claim 2 or 3, wherein the plurality of gas permeation sensors is arranged near the edge of the encapsulation.
5. The device of any of Claims 4 to 6, wherein each gas permeation sensor is spaced apart from an adjacent sensor at a distance of at least about 1 cm.

6. The device of any one of Claims 1 to 5, wherein each of the at least one gas permeation sensor is spaced apart from the electronic component at a distance of between about 1 [mu]m and about 100 [mu]m.
7. The device of any of Claims 1 to 6, wherein the gas permeation sensor is arranged at a location within the encapsulation not occupied by the electronic component.
8. The device of any of Claims 1 to 7, wherein an electrically insulating material is interposed between the at least one gas permeation sensor and the electronic component.
9. The device of Claim 8, wherein the electrically insulating material is selected from polyimide, parylene, polystyrene, polycarbonate and polyvinyl chloride.

10. The device of any of Claims 1 to 9, wherein the at least one gas permeation sensor has at least one physical or physico-chemical property that is at least substantially the same as the electronic component.

11. The device of Claims 10, wherein the at least one physical or physico-chemical property is selected from the group consisting of the dimension of the accessible surface of the at least one sensor, surface area-to-volume ratio and reactivity with moisture and/or oxygen.

12. The device of any one of Claims 1 to 11 , wherein the sensing element comprises a water and/or oxygen sensitive material selected from the group consisting of a conductive organic polymer, metal, metal alloy, metal oxide, and mixtures and a combination thereof.
13. The device of Claim 12, wherein the sensing element comprises a metal selected from the group consisting of calcium, iron, magnesium a combination thereof.

14. The device of Claim 12, wherein the conductive organic polymer is selected from the group consisting of polyaniline, polypyrrole and polythiophene, polyacetylene, poly-p-phenylene, and polyvinylpyridine, thiophene-bipyridine copolymers, polypyridine, polybipyridine, organometallic polyphenylenes and a combination thereof.
15. The device of Claim 12, wherein the metal oxide is selected from the group consisting of ln2[theta]3, Sn[theta]2, VO2, CrO2, MoO2, LiMn2O4,
Cd2SnO4, CdIn2O4, Zn2SnO4 and ZnSnO3, Zn2In2O5 and a combination thereof.

17. The device of Claim 16, wherein the protective layer comprises a material selected from the group consisting of a metal, a metal alloy, a metal oxide, a metal oxide mixture, a metal nitride, an organic polymer and a combination thereof.
18. The device of any one of Claims 1 to 17, further comprising a liner layer applied to at least one surface of the sensing element.
19. The device of Claim 18, wherein the liner layer is interposed between the sensing element and the base substrate.
20. The device of Claim 18 or 19, wherein the liner layer comprises an organic polymer that is substantially permeable to gas.
21. The device of Claim 20, wherein the organic polymer is selected from the group consisting of acrylic polymers, parylene type polymers (para-xylylene) and derivatives thereof.
22. The device of Claims 18 or 19, wherein the liner layer comprises an inorganic polymer.

27. The device of Claim 26, wherein the at least one barrier layer comprises a material selected from the group consisting of metals, metal oxides, ceramic oxides, inorganic polymers, organic polymers and mixtures and combinations thereof.
28. The device of Claims 27, wherein the organic polymers are selected from the group consisting of an epoxy polymer, polysulfide, silicone and polyurethane.

29. The device of any of Claims 25 to 28, wherein the multilayer film comprises at least one layer having distributed therein reactive nanoparticles capable of interacting with moisture and/or oxygen to retard the permeation of moisture and/or oxygen into the encapsulation.

35. The device of Claim 29, wherein the reactive nanoparticles interact with moisture and/or oxygen through adsorption.
36. The device of Claim 35, wherein the nanoparticles comprise carbon nanotubes.
37. The device of any of Claims 29 to 36, wherein the multilayer film further comprises inert nanoparticles capable of obstructing the permeation of moisture and/or oxygen into the encapsulation.

52. The device of any of Claims 1 to 51 , wherein the electronic component is selected from the group consisting of an Organic Light Emitting Device (OLED), charged-coupled device (CCD), micro-electromechanical sensor (MEMS), organic Thin-Film Transistor (TFT), and a solar cell.

69. A method of determining the status of an electronic component arranged within an encapsulated device as defined in any one of Claims 1 to 52, said method comprising: measuring the electrical conductivity/resistance of the gas permeation sensor arranged within the encapsulation, determining from said electrical conductivity/resistance of the sensor the amount of moisture and/or oxygen that has permeated into the encapsulation of the encapsulated device, and correlating the amount of moisture and/or oxygen that has permeated into the encapsulation of the encapsulated device to a status of the electronic component.
